Posted By: lorendorky (7/12/2011 11:38:10 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ntheawsome: [Into the Core](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Into the Core) says hi.  
@VampireCat: If the angel is your only creature, then [Gatekeeper of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gatekeeper of Malakir) says hi.  
  
It's tempting to try to come up with a way to protect this so you really can't ever lose, but it's also very, very hard, most likely impossible. The best I can come up with is the following:  
  
[Darksteel Forge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Forge) to make it indestructible.  
[Leonin Abunas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leonin Abunas) or [Indomitable Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Indomitable Archangel) to give it shroud.  
[Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice) to make your shroud generator an artifact and therefore also indestructible (plus all the rest of your permanents for that matter.)  
[Tajuru Preserver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tajuru Preserver) so you won't have to sac it.  
[Treacherous Link](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Treacherous Link) so that any damage that still manages to be dealt to it isn't, even through anti-prevention effects (negates [Everlasting Torment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Everlasting Torment)/[Hurricane](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hurricane) or similar, as well as ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@ntheawsome: Into the Core says hi.
@VampireCat: If the angel is your only creature, then Gatekeeper of Malakir says hi.

It's tempting to try to come up with a way to protect this so you really can't ever lose, but it's also very, very hard, most likely impossible. The best I can come up with is the following:

Darksteel Forge to make it indestructible.
Leonin Abunas or Indomitable Archangel to give it shroud.
Mycosynth Lattice to make your shroud generator an artifact and therefore also indestructible (plus all the rest of your permanents for that matter.)
Tajuru Preserver so you won't have to sac it.
Treacherous Link so that any damage that still manages to be dealt to it isn't, even through anti-prevention effects (negates Everlasting Torment/Hurricane or similar, as well as ... (see all)

posts.post_content:
I don't think people give this enough credit. Yes, it "dies to removal" even more than your average creature does, but there are plenty of ways to protect it, especially in M11. I drafted one of these in a mono-blue control deck I put together and they couldn't even touch it.  
  
Maybe i'm a bit biased, as this is the first mythic rare I ever opened, and it was shiny, too.

posts.post_content: All of this invincibility-combo. Honestly, [Final Judgement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Final Judgement) is the most fool-proof way of getting rid of anything. [Quicken](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quicken) it if need be. And use mana from [Boseiju, Who Shelters All](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boseiju, Who Shelters All) to cast it. If you cast it on your turn, only three things in the entire game can counter it, specifically [Venser, Shaper Savant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser, Shaper Savant), [Time Stop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stop) and [Mindbreak Trap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindbreak Trap) (excluding shenanigans like [Knowledge Pool](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knowledge Pool) and [Eye of the Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eye of the Storm))
posts.html:
All of this invincibility-combo. Honestly, Final Judgement is the most fool-proof way of getting rid of anything. Quicken it if need be. And use mana from Boseiju, Who Shelters All to cast it.
